data-bb3966ea4d7ed7ee8a0fd5c87150981b.label: SUP
data-bb3966ea4d7ed7ee8a0fd5c87150981b.sentence: The Alexander Pushkin (Russian: Алекса́ндр Пу́шкин) is a 320.65 carat colorless raw diamond, the second largest gem diamond ever found in Russia or the territory of the former Soviet Union (after the 26th Congress of the CPSU), and one of the largest in the world as of 2016

data-bb3966ea4d7ed7ee8a0fd5c87150981b.label: REF
data-bb3966ea4d7ed7ee8a0fd5c87150981b.sentence: The Alexander Pushkin (Russian: Алекса́ндр Пу́шкин) is a 320.65 carat colorless raw diamond, the second largest gem diamond ever found in Russia or the territory of the former Soviet Union (after the 26th Congress of the CPSU), and one of the largest in the world as of 2016

data-bb3966ea4d7ed7ee8a0fd5c87150981b.label: NEI
data-bb3966ea4d7ed7ee8a0fd5c87150981b.sentence: The Alexander Pushkin (Russian: Алекса́ндр Пу́шкин) is a 320.65 carat colorless raw diamond, the second largest gem diamond ever found in Russia or the territory of the former Soviet Union (after the 26th Congress of the CPSU), and one of the largest in the world as of 2016

data-bb3966ea4d7ed7ee8a0fd5c87150981b.label: SUP
data-bb3966ea4d7ed7ee8a0fd5c87150981b.sentence: It was mined at the Udachnaya kimberlitic pipe (Yakutia, Far Eastern Federal District) in December 1989 and named after the world-famous Russian writer Alexander Pushkin

data-bb3966ea4d7ed7ee8a0fd5c87150981b.label: REF
data-bb3966ea4d7ed7ee8a0fd5c87150981b.sentence: It was mined at the Udachnaya kimberlitic pipe (Yakutia, Far Eastern Federal District) in December 1989 and named after the world-famous Russian writer Alexander Pushkin
